channel.title: Mumbai News, Latest Mumbai News, Mumbai News Today and Headlines | Hindustan Times
channel.description: Mumbai News - Find latest Mumbai news and Headlines based from Mumbai City. Also check out latest news belongs to Mumbai crime, Mumbai education news, Mumbai real estate, Mumbai politics and more at Hindustan Times.
channel.copyright: Copyright (C) 2019 HT Media Limited. All Rights Reserved.

image.title: Mumbai News, Latest Mumbai News, Mumbai News Today and Headlines | Hindustan Times

item.title: Dharavi residents forced to use broken toilets; BMC silent after multiple complaints
item.description: Mumbai: Residents of Dharavi have been grappling with poor quality of public toilets on the 60ft road

item.title: Mumbai overtakes Delhi as most polluted city in India
item.description: On January 29, Mumbai was ranked 10th in the rankings for the poorest position.

item.title: Pawar rejects Fadnavis’s claim of forming govt in 2019 after consulting NCP chief
item.description: Fadnavis was sworn in as the chief minister and NCP’s Ajit Pawar his deputy before their government fell three days in 2019

item.title: Fadnavis claims he formed govt in 2019 with Pawar's support. NCP chief says…
item.description: Sharad Pawar stoutly denied Fadnavis's claim and said he never though the senior BJP leader will base his assertion on falsehood

item.title: Can’t have gag orders on drives like #BoycottBollywood: Anurag Thakur
item.description: Thakur was in Chembur as part of the Lok Sabha Pravas scheme rolled out to achieve 45 Lok Sabha seats from Maharashtra.

item.title: 12-yr-old boy saves little sisters but dies retrieving school bag from burning hut
item.description: A fire which broke out in a hutment on the hillock of forest land in Kurar village, Malad east, soon turned into a level-2 inferno. After at least five gas cylinders exploded in quick succession, it escalated gutting about 100 hutments

item.title: 7-year-old HIV-positive boy beats thalassemia
item.description: Beating all the odds, including getting HIV infection, a seven-year-old boy has managed to defeat thalassemia major—an inherited blood disorder characterised by decreased haemoglobin production

item.title: Eight-month pregnant woman killed for dowry
item.description: Mumbai: A man has been arrested for allegedly killing his eight-month pregnant wife for dowry in Dharavi

item.title: Patra Chawl project: Homebuyers contemplate moving HC after MHADA remains non-committal
item.description: Borikar refused to give clear timelines to the homebuyers from Ekta Tripolis, Kalpataru Radiance and The Luxor projects, stuck without an Occupancy Certificate (OC), as to when they will receive the possession of their homes. They have been waiting for close to 10 years

item.title: Dial 112: Navi Mumbai cops launch awareness campaign
item.description: Inaugurating the campaign, #AlertNaviMumbaikar, police commissioner Milind Bharambe said, “Even as the service is available from April 2021, there is little awareness among the people. Hence, we decided to organise a special campaign to spread the knowledge about the existence of such an emergency number

item.title: Furious residents stage ‘rasta roko’ over rash driving in Wadala, demand prompt action from police
item.description: Residents of the area said that over the last couple of years, the menace of rash driving, especially by taxi drivers, had increased at an alarming rate and it has been brought to the notice of the local police more than once.

item.title: First EAC meet highlights state’s potential to contribute for $5trillion economy
item.description: Chandrasekharan said India is the fifth largest economy and is well positioned to achieve the highest growth, marching high globally for years to come.

item.title: Teen motorist held for crashing into traffic cop, dragging him along
item.description: Mumbai: A traffic police constable from Vasai had to cling on to the bonnet of a car after the driver jumped a signal and refused to stop, crashed into the official and dragged him along for some distance on Sunday evening

item.title: Hyderabad engineer held for hoax bomb call to Google office in BKC
item.description: As per the police, the accused had called up Google’s BKC office late on Sunday night and said that a bomb had been placed in the tech giant’s Pune office.

item.title: 188 tonnes of flowers sent from city this Valentine’s season
item.description: Mumbai: Around 188 tonnes of flowers were sent to various international and domestic destinations in Valentine’s season from the city’s international airport

item.title: FDA launches drive to keep a check on e-pharmacy operations
item.description: After the CDSCO issued show cause notices questioning the legality of e-pharmacies, the Maharashtra FDA has launched an intensified drive to look at the operations of online portals selling medicines. The drive would focus on the processes followed for selling prescription drugs

item.title: Dahanu authority member expresses concerns over Vadhavan Port project
item.description: Mumbai: The Dahanu Taluka Environment Protection Authority (DTEPA) on Monday held its first full-strength hearing since the appointment of its new chairman

item.title: In Thane, rift between BJP and Shinde-led BSS widens
item.description: Recent complaints by two BJP MLAs—Sanjay Kelkar from Thane and Mihir Kotecha from Mulund—on the projects being pushed by CM Eknath Shinde have raised eyebrows in political circles and are being seen as an indication that not everything is hunky-dory in the BJP-BSS alliance

item.title: Doors of Mumbai-Shirdi Vande Bharat get stuck at Thane station
item.description: Transport experts stated that these are short-term problems that occur in the early stages of a new project, which usually continue for a few days and constant training on operating these new-age trains is needed.

item.title: MahaRERA urged to prevent builders from taking advance maintenance charges
item.description: Mumbai: Leading consumer body Mumbai Grahak Panchayat has written a letter to Maharashtra Real Estate Regulatory Authority (MahaRERA) chairperson Ajoy Mehta, seeking directions to promoters to stop collecting advance maintenance charges for one or two years from homebuyers and ensure formation of cooperative housing societies after more than 50% buyers book flats in a project

item.title: Powai shocker: Couple booked for sexual torture of PhD student
item.description: Mumbai: A student with a leading technology institute in Mumbai has filed a complaint alleging that a couple from Powai subjected him to torture, including sexual acts of a masochistic nature, for over a year

item.title: Talks fail, infra projects in city to be hit as tankers keep away
item.description: Mumbai: Several infrastructure projects in the city are likely to be impacted if the strike called by the Water Tanker Association of Mumbai (WTAM), on February 8, is not resolved soon

item.title: Lalitha Lajmi - A view into her soul
item.description: Her retrospective opened on 12th January, 2023, exactly a month before her death. It opened because she had dreamed of a befitting recognition for her contribution in Indian Art History as the only woman to have turned the gaze of the muse on herself. Until her, women had only been depicted as nude anatomical studies by male painters

item.title: Zia Mohyedddin (1931 - 2023): A teller of stories like none other
item.description: Zia Mohyeddin was a fastidious man, a fastidious artist, a fastidious teacher and a rasik in the truest sense of the term

item.title: BEST gets India’s first AC e-double decker bus, to run it on Bandra-Kurla route from this week
item.description: The Brihanmumbai Electric Supply and Transport (BEST) Undertaking on Monday received the country’s first AC electric double decker bus from the manufacturer

item.title: Protests build up against government’s ‘interfaith marriages committee’
item.description: The groups have formed a committee called ‘Salokha Samiti’ (harmony committee) to demand the withdrawal of the interfaith panel. Alleging that the government’s intention was solely to harass people from a particular community, they said the interfaith marriage committee was a precursor to bringing in an anti-conversion law in Maharashtra

item.title: Have always toed party line: Thorat
item.description: The development comes days after Satyajeet, who won from the Nashik Graduates’ Constituency as an independent candidate, said he would continue to work as an independent legislator.

item.title: Court rejects Purvi Modi’s plea for ED’s intervention in bankruptcy proceedings against Nirav
item.description: Mumbai: A special Fugitive Economic Offenders (FEO) court on Monday rejected the plea of Purvi Mehta, the sister of fugitive diamantaire Nirav Modi, seeking orders to the Enforcement Directorate (ED) to intervene in the bankruptcy proceedings being conducted before a US court against her brother

item.title: MU to have book on mapping Mumbai’s culture and diversity
item.description: Mumbai: So far, many books have been published about Mumbai

item.title: BEST to offer a host of incentives to passengers
item.description: The Brihanmumbai Electric Supply and Transport (BEST) Undertaking is introducing a slew of sops for Mumbaiites

item.title: Umesh Kolhe murder: Accused vet seeks bail, claims he is staunch Sunni Muslim, not Tablighi Jamaat member
item.description: Mumbai: Yusuf Khan, a veterinary doctor, one of the accused in the murder of Amravati pharmacist Umesh Kolhe, on Monday moved a bail plea before a NIA court

item.title: Will of 49th Dai proves nass can be changed: Defendant
item.description: Fredun Di’Vitre, counsel for defendant Syedna Mufaddal Saifuddin, submitted that the plaintiffs had raised doubts about the will because of the change in handwriting.

item.title: City sees only one measles outbreak in 2023
item.description: Since the outbreak in the M-East ward (Govandi) in October 2022, the city has seen 20 casualties, out of which 12 are suspected measles deaths.

item.title: After IIT Bombay student's ‘suicide’, group alleges ‘caste discrimination'
item.description: The Powai Police said the deceased was a first-year student of chemical engineering and had joined the institute three months ago.

item.title: ‘Ailing MLAs brought..’: Fadnavis hits back at Ajit Pawar's 'selfish BJP' swipe
item.description: Devendra Fadnavis was in Dombivali here to attend a two-day conclave connected to the Brahmin community

item.title: Malad BPO employee case: Police file chargesheet against boyfriend, but exclude his mother’s name
item.description: The police have dropped the name of Radhika Darekar from the charge-sheet filed against her son Amey who was charged with trying to kill his girlfriend Priyangi Singh, an employee with a BPO in Malad

item.title: A son rises in Thane
item.description: Over the past few months, Shrikant, the two-term MP from Kalyan, has emerged as a powerful member of the Shinde camp. In fact, he is clearly seen as Number Two, handling as he does organisational matters and political management of the fledgling party.

item.title: Bomb threat at Google office in Pune, caller held in Hyderabad: Police
item.description: Police officials later on Monday morning said a man claimed to be in an inebriated state, was later detained in Hyderabad for making the call which turned out to be a hoax

item.title: Koshyari out, Ramesh Bais is the new governor of Maharashtra
item.description: The President of India has accepted the resignation of Bhagat Singh Koshyari as governor of Maharashtra. Ramesh Bais, governor of Jharkhand appointed as governor of Maharashtra. The above appointment will take effect from the dates they assume charge of their respective offices,” stated a press communique from Rashtrapati Bhavan

item.title: 186 species spotted during bird survey in Tansa Sanctuary
item.description: he first-ever bird survey in Tansa Wildlife Sanctuary was conducted this weekend and the volunteers recorded 186 species of birds. The survey coincided with the 53rd anniversary of the sanctuary located in Shahapur tehsil of Thane district on Sunday

item.title: Adani reports electricity theft worth ₹14 lakh
item.description: The development came after electricity meters were checked by the vigilance department of the distribution company earlier in the week.

item.title: 18-year-old IIT-B student dies by suicide
item.description: According to the Powai police, the deceased was a first-year student of chemical engineering and had joined the institute three months ago. A native of Ahmedabad in Gujarat, he was staying with a roommate on the eighth floor of the Hostel 16/B on the campus

item.title: Meet Ramesh Bais, the new governor of Maharashtra
item.description: Bais started his political career by being elected as a councillor from Raipur Municipal Corporation in 1978 for the first time. Within two years, he was elected as an MLA from Mandir Hasod Constituency. In 1989, he successfully contested the Lok Sabha polls and continued to work as a parliamentarian till 2019. Born on August 2, 1947, Bais was the governor of Tripura before assuming the new role in the eastern state

item.title: Mission 150: BJP chalks out plan to win BMC polls
item.description: The Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) has set a target of winning 150 out of 227 seats in the upcoming Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) polls. The party has also decided to encourage Shiv Sena (UBT) faction workers to join the BJP

item.title: Taxi runs over mother of four in Wadala
item.description: The accused – identified as Nasir Sheikh – was at such a high speed that the impact of the accident did not stop his taxi.

item.title: Journalist killed in Ratnagiri: State announces ₹25 lakh compensation to family
item.description: Ratnagiri district guardian minister Uday Samant announced that Chief Minister Eknath Shinde has approved financial aid of ₹25 lakh to the family of Warise. “ ₹10 lakh will be given from the chief minister’s relief fund and ₹15 lakh from other sources,” he added. “The government will also give a job to Warise’s son.”

item.title: A son rises in Thane
item.description: Over the past few months, Shrikant, the two-term MP from Kalyan, has emerged as a powerful member of the Shinde camp. In fact, he is clearly seen as Number Two, handling as he does organisational matters and political management of the fledgling party.

item.title: Insta ‘friend’ extorts ₹3.68 lakh from married woman
item.description: “On February 8, the accused – who identified himself as Alex Lorenzo – had sent me a gift for Valentine’s day. He also said that I would have to pay a fee of €750 after receiving the parcel which he has kept in an envelope inside it,” the complainant told the police.

item.title: Cabinet clears controversial IPS officer Rashmi Shukla’s empanelment
item.description: The empanelment will clear Shukla’s path to either head a central force or come back to Maharashtra in an important post.

item.title: Man, 50, son, 19, arrested for raping minor relative for 9 years
item.description: On Saturday, the girl confided about the instances to her parents, following which they approached the local police in the Palghar district with a complaint. The police registered a case and transferred it to the MHB Colony police station in Borivali in whose jurisdiction the girl’s uncle lives.

item.title: Navi Mumbai police send proposal for three new police stations
item.description: Navi Mumbai: Keeping in mind the increasing population, especially in rapidly developing localities like Ulwe node and the areas around the proposed Navi Mumbai International Airport, the city police proposed the state government to set up three new police stations in the area and expand the jurisdictional zones of the commissionerate from two to three

item.title: India’s first electric AC double-decker bus to run on city streets this week
item.description: The BEST was expecting this bus to join its fleet in September 2022, which, however, got delayed. The manufacturer, on the other hand, stated that the delivery schedule was much on time and they said that Mumbai will start getting these buses this month

item.title: State employees to go on indefinite strike from March 14
item.description: Mumbai: Employees of the state government have threatened to go on indefinite strike from March 14 in protest of the old pension scheme

item.title: Disoriented compass, dolphin with duck’s nose… these are some of the BMC’s ideas of beautification
item.description: Morparia called the anomaly “an inadvertent joke indicating that we don’t know where we are going”. “We don’t know North from South,” he said wryly. “It succinctly sums up the current state of affairs. It’s also an admission without wanting to be one

item.title: Congress In-Charge pacifies Thorat, refuses to accept resignation
item.description: The veteran politician resigned on February 2 to protest against the “insult and humiliation” heaped on him and also expressed his inability to work with Nana Patole.

item.title: 1972 batch of Sir JJ Hospital helps restore miniature model of its heritage building
item.description: The original model was prepared by Late Bagaji Mhatre. The foundation stone of Sir JJ Hospital was laid on January 3, 1843, and its inauguration took place on May 15, 1845. Dr Shrinivas Shanbag, the 1972 batch alumnus who coordinated the restoration work of the miniature model, said they wanted to give back something to the institution as they celebrated 50 years of passing out

item.title: Malavika’s Mumbaistan: Badhai Ho!
item.description: Things changed when the wedding industry became a multi-armed and many-layered business and added to this came the explosion of new media and the many platforms it offered for the dissemination of news and information. Now there are paps, publicists and PROs to feed the public’s curiosity and vicarious pleasure in the spectacle

item.title: BMC polls on mind, Uddhav reaches out to north Indians
item.description: Addressing a gathering of north Indians in Goregaon, Thackeray called for unity. The move was seen as an attempt to develop and strengthen the bond between Sena (UBT) and the north Indian community ahead of the Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) polls

item.title: Two booked for duping developer of ₹30 lakh for over three years
item.description: The accused – identified as Ashraf Mamtule and Ulka Jadhav – lured the complainant to get him a loan of ₹1 crore for a new project.

item.title: Adani issue: 70 AAP workers marching towards BJP office detained
item.description: Nearly 70 Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) workers were detained for marching towards the state BJP office from Churchgate station on Sunday morning over the Adani issue. Ruben Mascarenhas, AAP national joint secretary and city working president, said that the Adani scam is the largest scam in independent India

item.title: Two killed in house slab collapse in Bhandup
item.description: wo persons were killed after a portion of a makeshift attic in a ground-plus-one house collapsed in Khindipada of Bhandup West on Sunday. The deceased have been identified as Rajkumar Sahay, 21, and Ramavtar Yadav (Lallan Kumar), 20

item.title: Sharad Pawar seeks probe against outgoing governor: 'Decisions BS Koshyari took…'
item.description: Welcoming BS Koshyari being shown the door, Sharad Pawar said, “Maharashtra has finally heaved a sigh of relief."
